{"step_by_step_thinking": "HIV is primarily produced and propagated in circulating T4 lymphocytes. These lymphocytes are the main target cells for HIV infection and replication. The virus attaches to CD4 receptors on the surface of T4 lymphocytes, enters the cells, and uses the host cell machinery to replicate and produce new virus particles. Therefore, the correct answer is B. Circulating T4 lymphocytes.", "answer_choice": "B"}
